headNote.p: Under this column name, the Birth Control Review published letters written to Margaret Sanger with occasional commentary. For others in this series see Margaret Sanger's Own Corner, Feb. 1924, Mar. 1924, Apr. 1924 May 1924, and June 1924.

div.p: Under this heading, month by month, Margaret Sanger will reply to some of the hundreds of questions that come to her. Sometimes one reply will answer many people, for the problems presented are often the same, though sent from far distant States and cities. Sometimes one person may voice a question that is in the minds of hundreds of other people, who perhaps have found no way of uttering it. If you have such a question in mind address it to 'Margaret Sanger's Own Corner' Birth Control Review.
STRANGER AND WIFE-- Your letter received. I sympathize with you in your difficult problem, of which there is not reason to be ashamed. If you will send address will write you personally.

ALH-- It is certainly not advisable for a woman, however healthy, to have a second child within two years of the first. Three years is a better interval. One of the great advantages of Birth Control is the possibility it presents of spacing the babies.
CHICAGO CLINIC-- The operation of clinics is a matter of State law, and is not affected by the fact that the Federal law prohibits the sending of Birth Control information through the mails.
